meanings.definition: A person from whom one is descended; an ancestor.
meanings.sent1: My forbearers came from a distant land to start a new life here.
meanings.sent2: Learning about our forbearers helps us understand our family history.
meanings.sent3: I like to imagine my forbearers cheering me on from the past.
meanings.sent4: The roots of our family tree run deep, connecting us to our forbearers.
meanings.sent5: The stories of our forbearers are like treasures passed down through generations.

meanings.definition: One that precedes another in time; a predecessor.
meanings.sent1: The ancient civilization was the forbearer of modern society.
meanings.sent2: The forbearer of this invention laid the foundation for future advancements.
meanings.sent3: The old clock tower stood as a forbearer of the town's rich history.
meanings.sent4: The forbearer of this tradition paved the way for its continued practice.
meanings.sent5: The forbearer of this idea sparked a revolution in the field of science.
